newsitem.title: UK: SBC Warburg denies "clearing" Hobson payment.
newsitem.headline: SBC Warburg denies "clearing" Hobson payment.

text.p: SBC Warburg, the investment banking arm of Swiss Bank Corp, on Monday denied press reports that it had cleared a payment to a Cayman Islands company by Hobson Plc when the latter negotiated an extension of a food supply agreement with Britain's Co-operative Wholesale Society in 1995.
Hobson was then run by Andrew Regan whose Galileo bidding vehicle is now trying to take over the rest of the CWS business, including a bank and an insurance company.

Regan has said that his advisers knew of the two million pound payment but SBC said it only knew that the supply agreement was to be extended in January 1995 and was not informed of the payment to the Cayman company Trellis by Hobson until March 1995.
"Shortly thereafter SBC resigned as financial adviser to Hobson," SBC Warburg said in a statement.

The investment bank is now advising CWS on its bid defence against Galileo. Galileo was stopped from launching a bid last Friday by a court order granted to CWS calling for Galileo and Regan to hand back any confidential material it has obtained about CWS.
